title: Minimal Land for Cereal Production
description: In 2022, Antigua and Barbuda had only 5 hectares of land under cereal production, highlighting its limited agricultural capacity.

title: Low Technical Cooperation Grants
description: In 2021, Antigua and Barbuda received $530,000 in technical cooperation grants, indicating limited international support in this area.

title: Negative Net Bilateral Aid from the US
description: In 2021, Antigua and Barbuda experienced a net negative aid flow of approximately $40,000 from the United States, reflecting a financial outflow rather than support.

title: Minimal Support from WHO
description: In 2021, Antigua and Barbuda received just $3,200 in net official flows from WHO, suggesting limited health-related aid.

title: Negligible Methane Emissions from Buildings
description: In 2023, Antigua and Barbuda's methane emissions from buildings were a mere 0.0001 Mt CO2e, indicating minimal environmental impact in this sector.

title: Low Freshwater Withdrawals
description: In 2021, the total annual freshwater withdrawals in Antigua and Barbuda were 0.0044 billion cubic meters, reflecting efficient water usage.

title: Minimal Industrial Design Applications
description: In 2021, only 1 industrial design application was filed by residents, indicating limited innovation in this sector.

title: Small Armed Forces
description: As of 2016, Antigua and Barbuda had a total of 180 armed forces personnel, highlighting its small military presence.

title: Low Pupil-Teacher Ratio in Upper Secondary Education
description: In 2015, the pupil-teacher ratio in upper secondary education was 3.71, suggesting a favorable learning environment with more personalized attention.

title: Minimal Child Mortality Ages 5-9
description: In 2023, there was only 1 recorded death among children aged 5-9 years, indicating strong child health outcomes.
